intro: Piptostigma mayumbense, commonly known as the Mayumbense thornapple, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to Central Africa, particularly found in the Democratic Republic of the Congo and the Republic of the Congo. The plant is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its thorny stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white with five petals, and it produces small, round berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. The plant is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
